DirList

Lists files of directory with sizes

Functions
main

Displays the contents of the directory provided as argument.  If no argument provided, displays the contents of the current directory.  Also displays the sizes of each file.  The list of files is sorted by the name of the file.  The filenames are displayed in /name-dot-extension/ format or just the name if the file has no extension.

Parameters
command line arguments

the directory and the filename.  Both are optional.  The filename can be ambiguous (containing ? and/or *).  The default directory is the current and the default filename matches any file.

Returns

nothing

Side Effects

Prints the list of filenames on the default console.

rdfn

Reads the file names using f_sfirst and f_snext system calls copies them into the array.  The filenames are null-terminated strings.

Parameters
ax

The address of the array for the pointers to the filenames.

Returns
ax

The number of filenames in the array.

Side Effects

The array contains the addresses of filenames.

Modified Registers

si, di, ax, bx, cx

fnconv

Converts 11-character filenames to <name><'.'><ext>.  The result is null-terminated.  The length of the string is returned in ax.

Parameters
si

The address of the source string

di

The address of the destination

Returns
ax

The length of the destination string (without the null-byte)

Modified Registers

si, di, ax, bx, cx
